name: Universiteit Hasselt
goal: Universiteit Hasselt is an independent innovative university which is regionally anchored and has a pronounced international orientation. The university stands for excellence in education, top research in a set number of spearhead fields and active engagement in innovation and entrepreneurship. The university aims to contribute to socially and economically relevant challenges, especially those that are important for the region. Unversiteit Hasselt strives for excellent academic teaching and research at an international and competitive level, with students, staff and collaborations with partners from all over the world. Universiteit Hasselt has grown into an innovative and dynamic university with 2 campuses (Diepenbeek and Hasselt), 6 research institutes, 7 faculties, 2 schools, 6 333 students, 549 PhD students and 1,402 academic, administrative and technical staff. 42% of the PhD students are international students. Universiteit Hasselt is also a member of the European University Association (EUA) and the UK Research Office (UKRO) and the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA).
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Universiteit Hasselt follows all relevant EU initiatives and policies concerning research, innovation and education
In the past we have had engaged in activities in FP7, where we had been active as partners of approved projects as well as coordinating approved projects. Currently we also participate in activities in H2020. We have 28 approved H2020 projects (ERC grants, Marie Curie ITN and IF, Societal challenges and Industrial leadership) 4 approved projects for research for coal and steel. Of which we act as coordinator for one of them.
We also take part of European tenders and programmes (f.e. Justice programme, ERDF,...).
